title: Bank RMs, wealth managers don’t thrill India’s new class of millionaires. Who does then?
article: You are a new crorepati. The startup where you spent a decade just got listed and your wealth is concentrated around the company’s shares. Finally, the time has come for you to manage it, with some professional help. Where would you go? To the traditional wealth managers sitting in their swanky offices giving advice in exchange for high commissions, with high reliance on portfolio management services (PMS) that focuses on mutual funds, stocks,

title: McDonald’s India serves a comeback in Q1 FY25 after 3 quarters of losses
article: The first quarter of this financial year brought trying times for the restaurant business in India. A combined effect of general elections, inflation, and job cuts has left most restaurants empty. Consumers who continue to eat out are opting for takeouts rather than dining in, according to the new National Restaurant Association of India report. The overall sentiment of the restaurant business has not been the best this quarter. However,

title: Smooth flight or turbulence? What IndiGo, SpiceJet Q2 results are expected to land.
article: Over the coming few weeks, India’s airlines are expected to announce their second-quarter results, traditionally marked by subdued travel. IndiGo, India’s largest airline by market share, and SpiceJet, the country’s oldest private airline, are expected to post small profits or small losses, according to analysts. title: Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and upside potential of up to 33%
article: The market reaction to some of the initial Q2 numbers suggests it is likely to stay under the control of the bulls. The only caveat: There shouldn’t be trouble emanating from the global markets, that too any readjustment of China weight. title: PSU bank stocks: Stay bullish, avoid narrative trap. 7 PSU banks with upside potential of 31 to 43%
article: Do a Google search for “PSU bank in the US”. It throws up just one result. Now do a similar search for “private sector banks in China”. A long list appears. Both results are surprising. In a country like China, where how much time kids watch TV is controlled by the government, there is hardly anything that is in reality owned by the private sector. title: Top Nifty50 stocks analysts suggest buying in this volatile week
article: The following list of stocks in the headline index Nifty50 were given “Strong Buy/Buy” recommendations in the latest Stock Reports Plus report dated October 14, 2024.
